edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Util

  • public class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    The Util class stores a few helper functions that we use inside of LOL, and a few simple wrappers that we give to the game developer

      • makePicture

        public static Renderable makePicture(float x,
                                     float y,
                                     float width,
                                     float height,
                                     java.lang.String imgName)
        Create a Renderable that consists of an image
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner, in pixels
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner, in pixels
        width - The image width, in pixels
        height - The image height, in pixels
        imgName - The file name for the image, or ""
        Returns:
        A Renderable of the image

      • makeText

        public static Renderable makeText(int x,
                                  int y,
                                  java.lang.String message,
                                  int red,
                                  int green,
                                  int blue,
                                  java.lang.String fontName,
                                  int size)
        Create a Renderable that consists of some text to draw
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the bottom left corner, in pixels
        y - The Y coordinate of the bottom left corner, in pixels
        message - The text to display... note that it can't change on the fly
        red - The red component of the font color (0-255)
        green - The green component of the font color (0-255)
        blue - The blue component of the font color (0-255)
        fontName - The font to use
        size - The font size
        Returns:
        A Renderable of the text

      • makeText

        public static Renderable makeText(java.lang.String message,
                                  int red,
                                  int green,
                                  int blue,
                                  java.lang.String fontName,
                                  int size)
        Create a Renderable that consists of some text to draw. The text will be centered vertically and horizontally on the screen
        Parameters:
        message - The text to display... note that it can't change on the fly
        red - The red component of the font color (0-255)
        green - The green component of the font color (0-255)
        blue - The blue component of the font color (0-255)
        fontName - The font to use
        size - The font size
        Returns:
        A Renderable of the text

      • getRandom

        public static int getRandom(int max)
        Generate a random number x such that 0 <= x < max
        Parameters:
        max - The largest number returned will be one less than max
        Returns:
        a random integer

      • drawBoundingBox

        public static void drawBoundingBox(float x0,
                                   float y0,
                                   float x1,
                                   float y1,
                                   java.lang.String imgName,
                                   float density,
                                   float elasticity,
                                   float friction)
        Draw a box on the scene Note: the box is actually four narrow rectangles
        Parameters:
        x0 - X coordinate of top left corner
        y0 - Y coordinate of top left corner
        x1 - X coordinate of bottom right corner
        y1 - Y coordinate of bottom right corner
        imgName - name of the image file to use when drawing the rectangles
        density - Density of the rectangle. When in doubt, use 1
        elasticity - Elasticity of the rectangle. When in doubt, use 0
        friction - Friction of the rectangle. When in doubt, use 1

      • drawPicture

        public static void drawPicture(float x,
                               float y,
                               float width,
                               float height,
                               java.lang.String imgName,
                               int zIndex)
        Draw a picture on the current level Note: the order in which this is called relative to other actors will determine whether they go under or over this picture.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of bottom left corner
        y - Y coordinate of bottom left corner
        width - Width of the picture
        height - Height of this picture
        imgName - Name of the picture to display
        zIndex - The z index of the image. There are 5 planes: -2, -2, 0, 1, and 2. By default, everything goes to plane 0

      • drawText

        public static void drawText(float x,
                            float y,
                            java.lang.String text,
                            int red,
                            int green,
                            int blue,
                            java.lang.String fontName,
                            int size,
                            int zIndex)
        Draw some text on the current level Note: the order in which this is called relative to other actors will determine whether they go under or over this text.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of bottom left corner of the text
        y - Y coordinate of bottom left corner of the text
        text - The text to display
        red - The red component of the color (0-255)
        green - The green component of the color (0-255)
        blue - The blue component of the color (0-255)
        fontName - The name of the font file to use
        size - The font size to use
        zIndex - The z index of the image. There are 5 planes: -2, -2, 0, 1, and 2. By default, everything goes to plane 0

      • drawTextCentered

        public static void drawTextCentered(float centerX,
                                    float centerY,
                                    java.lang.String text,
                                    int red,
                                    int green,
                                    int blue,
                                    java.lang.String fontName,
                                    int size,
                                    int zIndex)
        Draw some text on the current level, centered on a point. Note: the order in which this is called relative to other actors will determine whether they go under or over this text.
        Parameters:
        centerX - X coordinate of center of the text
        centerY - Y coordinate of center of the text
        text - The text to display
        red - The red component of the color (0-255)
        green - The green component of the color (0-255)
        blue - The blue component of the color (0-255)
        fontName - The name of the font file to use
        size - The font size to use
        zIndex - The z index of the image. There are 5 planes: -2, -2, 0, 1, and 2. By default, everything goes to plane 0
